intro: Hepatica hepatica var. purpurea, commonly known as the purple hepatica, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its early spring blooms. The plant features distinctive, palmate leaves that are often hairy and have a waxy texture. Its flowers are typically blue or purple, with five to seven petals and a yellow center. It thrives in woodland environments and is often found in shaded, moist soils.
